metadata.title: Take This Sabbath Day
metadata.writer: Aaron Sorkin, Lawrence O'Donnell Jr., Paul Redford

releases.details: Part of the Season 1 DVD release.
special_features: Commentary by Aaron Sorkin and Thomas Schlamme

notes: This episode features guest stars Marlee Matlin and Karl Malden.
The episode addresses the moral implications of capital punishment.

real_world_cultural_references: Supreme Court of the United States decisions.
The impact of faith on moral decisions.

continuity_notes: Introduces Joey Lucas as a recurring character.
Explores the moral complexities faced by President Bartlet.

plot.plot_summary: The episode begins with a Supreme Court ruling denying a stay on the execution of Simon Cruz. As President Bartlet contemplates commuting the sentence, he consults with Father Cavanaugh. Meanwhile, Toby grapples with his beliefs on capital punishment during a synagogue sermon. Josh assists Joey Lucas, a determined and deaf campaign manager, who seeks action for her underfunded candidate while the clock ticks down to the execution. Tensions rise as Bartlet is faced with a moral dilemma, culminating in his visit to confession as he seeks guidance on his decision.
